channel.title: Connecting Classes?

item.title: Connecting Classes?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:7, topic:544691”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=663565.msg4434694#msg4434694 date=1404674097]
Okay your first mistake was not doing <?php
[/quote]<? is accepted (I think by default actually) depending on your settings…

[quote author=marc_osrs link=topic=663565.msg4434691#msg4434691 date=1404674004]

require(‘file_name.php’)

Can you use google before you post next time?

in the class? or at the top of the page
[/quote]Just put it at the top of the page.[/quote]
Using the shorthand tag is accepted by some hosts, but not by all.

sk8rdude461:

Another tip (at least this is based on what I was told, I don’t really know if it’s true or anything) is that you shouldn’t end your file with php ( ?> ). I always put at the end if there’s going to be no actual html on the page.

Don’t close your php tag, just leave it open. You don’t need to declare html either, just leave it as is. For example:
[php]

<?php $something = "hi"; echo $something; [/php] Would suffice and it's actually recognised as being faster in some situations IIRC.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting Classes?
item.dc:creator: @marc_osrs marc_osrs
item.description:
@marc_osrs wrote:

When using Object Oriented Programming: PHP you have the ability to go into another classes function.
example:

<?
class fruit{
 var $fruit;
     function set_fruit($new_fruit){
          $this->fruit = $new_fruit;
     }
     function get_fruit(){
          return $this->fruit;
     }
}

class checkFood extends fruit{
     function get_all_foods(){
          $fruit = new fruit;
          $fruit->set_fruit("Apple");
          $fruit->get_fruit();
          $fruit = $fruit->get_fruit();
          if ($fruit == "Apple"){
               echo "It's a fruit";
          }
          else{
               echo "Not a fruit";
          }
     }
}

// Outputs "it's a fruit"
?>

Now what if i had another file containing the class “vegetables” and i wanted to use the checkFood class how would I connect these files to each other so that I could do that? besides just putting it in the same file?

Read full topic
